desc.all_saints: A day honoring all saints, known and unknown, celebrated in the Western Church on November 1
desc.john_baptist_nativity: Celebration of the birth of John the Baptist, precursor of Christ, on June 24
desc.candlemas: Commemorates the presentation of Jesus at the Temple and the purification of Mary, celebrated on February 2
desc.theophany: The Eastern Orthodox celebration of Christ's baptism and manifestation as God, on January 19 (Julian January 6)
desc.annunciation: Celebrates the announcement by the Angel Gabriel to the Virgin Mary that she would conceive and bear Jesus, on March 25
desc.transfiguration: Commemorates the transfiguration of Jesus on the mountain before Peter, James, and John, on August 6
desc.christmas: Celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ on December 25 in the Western tradition
desc.christmas_orthodox: Celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ on January 7 (Julian December 25) in the Eastern Orthodox tradition
desc.epiphany: Celebrates the visit of the Magi to the infant Jesus, observed on January 6 in the Western tradition
desc.assumption: Celebrates the taking up of the Virgin Mary into heaven, body and soul, on August 15
desc.mary_nativity: Celebrates the birth of the Virgin Mary, mother of Jesus, on September 8
desc.holy_cross: Commemorates the finding of the True Cross by Saint Helena, celebrated on September 14
desc.immaculate_conception: Catholic feast celebrating Mary's conception without original sin, on December 8

fixed-feasts.info_traditions: Some feasts are observed by both Western and Eastern churches, while others are specific to one tradition
fixed-feasts.info_julian: Eastern Orthodox dates shown are Julian calendar dates converted to Gregorian (13-day difference)
fixed-feasts.info_fixed: Fixed feasts occur on the same calendar date each year, unlike movable feasts which depend on Easter
fixed-feasts.empty_state: Enter a year to view fixed Christian feasts for that year
fixed-feasts.footer_note: Dates shown are in the Gregorian calendar. Eastern Orthodox dates account for the 13-day Julian calendar offset.

fixed-christian-feasts.description: Calculate dates for fixed Christian feasts such as Christmas, Epiphany, and Annunciation for any year in both Western and Eastern traditions.
fixed-christian-feasts.title: Fixed Christian Feasts Calculator

movable-feasts.tooltip_year: Enter the Gregorian year to calculate movable Christian holy days
movable-feasts.info_movable: Movable feasts change dates each year based on the calculation of Easter Sunday
movable-feasts.empty_state: Enter a year to view movable Christian holy days for that year

desc.sexagesima: The second Sunday before Lent, approximately 60 days before Easter
desc.easter_monday: The day after Easter Sunday, observed as a public holiday in many countries
desc.laetare_sunday: The fourth Sunday of Lent, also known as Refreshment Sunday or Rose Sunday
desc.good_friday: Commemorates the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary
desc.divine_mercy: Celebrated on the Sunday after Easter, focuses on the mercy of God
desc.easter: Celebrates the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead
desc.ascension: Commemorates Jesus Christ's ascension into heaven 40 days after Easter
desc.trinity_sunday: Celebrates the Christian doctrine of the Trinity: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit
desc.maundy_thursday: Commemorates the Last Supper of Jesus with his disciples
desc.septuagesima: The third Sunday before Lent, approximately 70 days before Easter
desc.palm_sunday: Commemorates Jesus' triumphal entry into Jerusalem, one week before Easter
desc.holy_saturday: The day between Good Friday and Easter Sunday, also called Black Saturday
desc.quinquagesima: The Sunday before Lent begins, approximately 50 days before Easter
desc.ash_wednesday: The first day of Lent, marked by ashes and repentance
desc.pentecost: Celebrates the descent of the Holy Spirit upon the Apostles, 50 days after Easter
desc.corpus_christi: Honors the Eucharist, celebrated on the Thursday after Trinity Sunday

movable-feasts.info_computus: Easter is calculated using the Computus algorithm, which determines the first Sunday after the first full moon following the spring equinox
movable-feasts.info_difference: Western and Eastern Easter dates differ due to different calendar systems (Gregorian vs Julian) and calculation methods
movable-feasts.footer_note: Dates are calculated using the Computus algorithm. Western uses Gregorian calendar, Eastern uses Julian calendar converted to Gregorian.

movable-christian-holy-days.title: Movable Christian Holy Days Calculator
movable-christian-holy-days.description: Calculate dates for movable Christian holy days such as Easter, Ash Wednesday, Pentecost, and Ascension for any year in both Western and Eastern traditions.
